intro: Lacunaria pulchrinervis, commonly known as the beautiful-veined lacunaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves with intricate, reticulate venation patterns. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color. Native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture and botanical gardens.
